definition: to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: They are adept at many special skills.
sentences.chinese: 他们有很多拿手的绝活儿。

sentences.english: Gerhardt ran his hand through his reddish brown hair distractedly .
sentences.chinese: 葛哈德只是发狂似地拿手挠他那红褐色的头发。

sentences.english: Playing the guitar is my thing.
sentences.chinese: 弹吉他是我的拿手好戏。

sentences.english: The chef's specialty is shrimps with crispy fried rice crust.
sentences.chinese: 厨师的拿手菜是虾仁锅巴。

sentences.english: The dish that he cooks best is tender ginger stir fried with meat slices.
sentences.chinese: 他最拿手的一道菜就是子姜炒肉丝。

sentences.english: Making phone calls while working on computer at the same time is Xiaocao's specialty.
sentences.chinese: 一边打电话一边用电脑工作是小曹的拿手戏。

sentences.english: In my best Slovak, I asked, “Where is a campground?”
sentences.chinese: 我用最拿手的斯洛伐克语问，“宿营地在哪儿？”

sentences.english: Our band shines when we play the songs we know best.
sentences.chinese: 我们的乐队在演奏拿手歌曲时表现出众。

sentences.english: Then Father's hand gently covered her mouth.
sentences.chinese: 父亲拿手轻轻地掩住她的嘴。

sentences.english: Please bring two to three great dishes to share.
sentences.chinese: 请每家带两三道拿手好菜，大伙共享佳淆。

sentences.english: Be regarded as the mother's that specialty vegetables, is also a can't stop come-on.
sentences.chinese: 就算是母亲的那道拿手菜，也是一份不会停止的诱惑。

sentences.english: She regaled the guests with the best dishes she could offer.
sentences.chinese: 她以她最拿手的菜款待客人。

sentences.english: Crying is the baby's forte. Whenever she cries, her mother doesn't know how to deal with her.
sentences.chinese: 哭可是宝宝的拿手戏，只要她一哭，妈妈没辙了。

definition: to be good at/to be expert in
to have a skill/to have a lot on the ball/to have an affair
unique skill/unexpected tricky move (as a last resort)/masterstroke/finishing blow
a skill/mastery of a trade/by oneself/without outside help
personal strength/one's special ability or strong points
to look after the house/(of skill, ability) special/outstanding
to reach perfection (idiom); a superb artistic achievement
not presentable/not fit to be seen in company
